text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 4.62.3, International Relations, Requests for Representation Funds and Gifts for Foreign Officials.

IRM 4.62.3.1, Program Scope and Objectives: Added Purpose, Audience, Policy Owner, Program Owner, and Primary Stakeholders paragraphs in accordance with IRM 1.11.2, Internal Management Documents System, Internal Revenue Manual (IRM) Process.

Added internal control subsections for Program Management and Review (IRM 4.62.3.1.4), Program Controls (IRM 4.62.3.1.5), and Related Resources (IRM 4.62.3.1.7) in accordance with IRM 1.11.2.2.5 Address Management and Internal Controls.
Replaced Assistant Deputy Commissioner International (ADCI) with LB&I Program Manager of Strategic Programs throughout.
All operating divisions and functions are required to use this IRM.
Assistant Deputy Commissioner Compliance Integration Large Business and International Division
Requests for Representation Funds and Gifts for Foreign Officials
Requests for Representation Funds and Gifts for Foreign Officials 4.62.3 page

(1) Purpose: The Representation Fund (Rep. Fund) is a budget allocation used to facilitate official reception and representation activities that further the interests of the U.S. tax administration system. Such activities are intended to increase cooperation with foreign governments and with public or private organizations outside of the Federal Government.
Policy Owner: LB&I Policy under the Strategy, Policy and Governance office in the Assistant Deputy Commissioner Compliance Integration organization.
The LB&I Program Manager of Strategic Programs must pre-approve all Rep.Fund requests and approve all Rep. Fund reimbursement requests.
The Rep. Fund Coordinator maintains the list of IRS employees and guests participating in representation activity, including participants’ titles.
The following table contains commonly used acronyms and their deﬁnitions:
Acronym Deﬁnition PPS Procurement for the Public Sector Rep. Fund Representation Fund Resources (

) For the current Rep. Fund Coordinator information, see the Commissioner’s Representation Fund - Management page on the LB&I Program and Services site at https://irssource.web.irs.gov/LBI/Lists/LBI_Programs/Dis
. The current Rep. Fund ordinator is the ﬁrst name listed in the POC/Advisor section. Representation Fund Allocation (
) The Chief Financial Officer (CFO) allocates the Rep. Funds approved by Congress to LB&I Finance. (
) LB&I Finance allocates the entire ﬁscal year funding to LB&I Headquarters managing and maintaining the budget. (

) The Rep. Fund Coordinator, who is in the LB&I Resource Solutions Finance Customer Support Budget Team, creates a bulk funding account to be used reimburse the requester’s approved expenses. for Rep. Fund (

) Certain types of expenses associated with fulﬁlling the functions of the IRS normally allowable at the discretion of the authorizing official. These expenses include: a. Entertainment costs incurred to promote official relationships with governments, state officials and representatives of organizations necessary to enhance the performance of IRS. b. The purchase of centerpieces or other items dictated by custom for official functions or events. (This type of expense must receive prior approval because of certain appropriation prohibitions and fund limita- tions.) c. Alcoholic beverage purchases must be requested in advance and approved by LB&I Program Manager of Strategic Programs prior to purchase. d. Light refreshments for foreign dignitaries may use the Rep. Fund if requested and approved by LB&I Program Manager of Strategic Programs prior to the event. (

) Prior to approving any expenditure, the authorizing official examines the intended expenditure to determine whether: a. The scale of the entertainment is suited to the purpose for which the funds are to be expended. The rank and importance of the persons attendance to the nature and expense of the entertainment is evaluated. b. The number of federal employees and their spouses in attendance at function hosted by the Service is appropriate in relation to but cannot

Entertainment costs incurred to promote official relationships with governments, state officials and representatives of organizations necessary to enhance the performance of IRS. The purchase of centerpieces or other items dictated by custom for official functions or events. (This type of expense must receive prior approval because of certain appropriation prohibitions and fund limita

tions.) Alcoholic beverage purchases must be requested in advance and approved by LB&I Program Manager of Strategic Programs prior to purchase. Light refreshments for foreign dignitaries may use the Rep. Fund if requested and approved by LB&I Program Manager of Strategic Programs prior to the event.

The scale of the entertainment is suited to the purpose for which the funds are to be expended. The rank and importance of the persons in attendance to the nature and expense of the entertainment is evaluated. The number of federal employees and their spouses in attendance at a function hosted by the Service is appropriate in relation to but cannot
Requests for Representation Funds and Gifts for Foreign Officials 4.62.3 page

exceed the number of other attendees. (Additional IRS personnel beyond the number authorized may attend the representation functions at their personal expense.) Participation by relatives or companions of IRS employees attending an event for which Rep. Funds are expended will be reviewed to ensure that attendance is appropriate and necessary as dictated by proper etiquette. (In the presence of the spouse of a foreign dignitary, it would be appropri

ate for the IRS official to include his/her spouse). In the world of international business, the exchange of gifts between officials is commonplace. The Rep. Fund may be used to purchase gifts for foreign dignitaries as part of the expected code of behavior. However, such purchases and their accompanying circumstances must be reviewed and approved by LB&I Program Manager of Strategic Programs prior to purchase.
All Rep. Fund requests must be pre-approved by LB&I Program Manager of Strategic Programs prior to the funds being used.
) All Rep. Fund requests must be pre-approved by LB&I Program Manager Strategic Programs prior to the funds being used. (

) Expenses should not exceed the pre-approved amount. If an exception avoidably occurs, LB&I Program Manager of Strategic Programs reviews circumstances after the fact, and makes the determination regarding reimbursement. (

) The fund may not be used for: a. The hire, purchase, operation or repair of any passenger-carrying b. Expenses of printing or for the purchase of stationery or cards invitations to official functions. c. Expenses incurred for entertainment solely for employees of the Revenue Service and/or their families. (

) An IRS employee who has a meal paid for by the Rep. Fund and who per diem is not allowed to claim the entire meal and incidental expenditures & IE) amount on his/her travel voucher. If a person on per diem has a paid for by the Rep. Fund, he/she reduces the allowable M & IE rate on travel voucher. (

) Obtain forms required to request and process Rep. Fund expenditures by tacting the Rep. Fund Coordinator. These forms are also available on the website. Contact the Rep. Fund Coordinator regarding any Rep. Fund questions. (

) Requester should use a Small Purchase Card if time allows or a personal credit card or cash to pay for the meal or gifts using Rep. Funds. The adminis- trative assistant to the LB&I Program Manager of Strategic Programs or the administrative assistant to the LB&I Commissioner will be the cardholders have the correct merchant codes to do these transactions. If time does not allow, you may use a personal credit card and be reimbursed. (

) The Rep. Fund Coordinator is responsible for maintaining the following data: a. The list of IRS employees and guests participating in representation activity, including participants’ titles. In the case of foreign guests, the country represented should be listed. b. The date of activity, name and location (city/state) of the vendor providing the representation activity c. The amount of funds expended and photocopies of receipts d. The purpose of activity or expenditure e. The name and title of person receiving reimbursement (
) The Rep. Fund Coordinator and LB&I Program Manager of Strategic Programs will conduct a quarterly reconciliation of the Rep. Fund. Guidelines (

) The requester is to send the Rep. Fund Coordinator the following information: a. Name and title b. Post c. Telephone number d. Type of gift e. Name and title of recipient f. Name of foreign government g. Circumstances surrounding presentation of gift (
) Gifts that are not distributed are to be returned to the Rep. Fund Coordinator to be added back to the inventory. A note will be added to the original request about the return gift(s). Usage of (

) Last minute usage is allowed when a need occurs less than two weeks prior the event. Along with contacting the Rep. Fund Coordinator, you will be required to work with a designated purchase cardholder to pay for meal or gifts. The cardholder would be either the administrative assistant to LB&I Program Manager of Strategic Programs or the administrative assistant to LB&I Commissioner. They will be able to get special merchant codes that
outlined in IRM 4.62.3.3(2)(b), which covers non-authorized IRS employees who may attend representation activities at their own expense.
The Rep. Fund Coordinator is responsible for maintaining the following data:

a. The list of IRS employees and guests participating in representation activity, including participants’ titles. In the case of foreign guests, the country represented should be listed. b. The date of activity, name and location (city/state) of the vendor providing the representation activity c. The amount of funds expended and photocopies of receipts d. The purpose of activity or expenditure e. The name and title of person receiving reimbursement
The Rep. Fund Coordinator and LB&I Program Manager of Strategic Programs will conduct a quarterly reconciliation of the Rep. Fund.

Last minute usage is allowed when a need occurs less than two weeks prior to the event. Along with contacting the Rep. Fund Coordinator, you will be required to work with a designated purchase cardholder to pay for meal or gifts. The cardholder would be either the administrative assistant to LB&I Program Manager of Strategic Programs or the administrative assistant to the LB&I Commissioner. They will be able to get special merchant codes that will
allow them to make the purchase with the Small Purchase Card for dining. All other requirements for Rep. Funds are the same for a request within the two- week notice.
